[It is, therefore, evident that in figure 2
the <u>tractus internus <\u> contains two sets of fibres,
namely, those wh: have crossed in the corpus 
callosum of the opposite side & wh: have arched 
forwards & outwards, as well as those wh: are 
going to cross in the corpus callosum and wh:
have been derived from the frontal cortex of the 
same side. While the <u>tractus medius <\u> & <u>externus <\u>
both contain the fibres alone wh: have already <s>have run forwards 
& turned back <\s> crossed in the corpus callosum and 
wh: having circumvented the anterior horn of the 
ventricle are curving back towards the basal ganglia.
[The sum of these observations, so far as we have
gone, therefore, is that <u>all the fibres (unless those wh: are <s>not <\s>
merely interconvolutional, <s>(<\s> that is to say wh: run 
between one convolution and another in its neighbour-
hood) from the <\u>
